page.title: 01Preview of The Northill Area
page.content: Once part of the{Wixamtree Hundred, most of the area, except for the out- skirts of Moggerhanger, now falls within the administrative{Parish of {Northill.} The land is low-lying: the highest point is Mox Hill in the West at 68m, the site of underground reser- voirs, & the lowest is in the North at 23m. The soil is fertile, and used for agriculture. There is some meadowland and College, Home & Sheerhatch Woods constitute the main areas of woodland. The{village of Northill}is fairly small; the church of St. Mary Virgin stands in the centre of a Conservation Area surrounded by a public house, The Old Rectory, school and village hall. To the north are the hamlets of{Thorn- {cote,}a group of houses of varying age around a green, and{Hatch}with an old farmhouse, and renovated cottages. The whole embraces a small rural community
